Award.AwardTitle: NSF Student Travel Grants for the Twentieth ACM Workshop on Mobile Computing Systems and Applications (ACM HotMobile 2019)

Directorate.LongName: Direct For Computer & Info Scie & Enginr

Division.LongName: Division Of Computer and Network Systems

Award.AbstractNarration:
This award will support students at U.S. institutions to attend the Twentieth ACM Workshop on Mobile Computing Systems and Applications (ACM HotMobile 2019). HotMobile, sponsored by the Association for Computing Machinery's Special Insterest Group on Mobile Systems (ACM SIGMOBILE), will be held in Santa Cruz, California, February 27-28, 2019. HotMobile 2019 is the premier workshop targeting mobile computing and system integration fields. Attending this event will benefit the scientific progress of the student's research. The exposure to the technical content of HotMobile 2019 will inspire students to address the tough problems in their respective fields, with a long-term benefit of scientific advances in mobile computing.

Priority will be given to students who will benefit from attending this workshop but are unlikely to attend due to the unavailability of travel funding. In addition, applications from female and underrepresented groups in mobile computing research will be strongly encouraged. Up to 25 students will receive travel grants from this award to attend HotMobile 2019.

This award reflects NSF's statutory mission and has been deemed worthy of support through evaluation using the Foundation's intellectual merit and broader impacts review criteria.

POR.DRECONTENT:
This award supports students at U.S. institutions to attend the Twentieth ACM Workshop on Mobile Computing Systems and Applications (ACM HotMobile 2019). HotMobile, sponsored by ACM SIGMOBILE, was held in Santa Cruz, CA, February 27-28, 2019.

HotMobile 2019 is the premier workshop targeting mobile computing and system integration fields. HotMobile provides a collegial atmosphere and actively foster discussion among participants from the industrial, governmental, and academic sectors. The event is an excellent opportunity for students to learn about hot topics in mobile systems and applications, open research problems, and possible career options after graduation. The exposure to the technical content of HotMobile 2019 inspires students to address the tough problems in their respective fields, with a long-term benefit of scientific progress for the field of mobile computing. The travel funds allow graduate students conducting research in the field to attend high caliber technical presentations, be exposed to the state-of-the-art research, and interact with leading researchers and fellow graduate students, thereby making contacts potentially critical to their careers and future success. The impact on the students' careers from attending HotMobile 2019 is substantial.

The travel grant application process was advertised via the HotMobile 2019 website, Facebook page, and through multiple mailing lists. A selection committee of 3 individuals from the HotMobile organizing committee and technical program committee reviewed the applications, and decisions were made primarily based on merit, including the applicant's interests and accomplishments in the mobile systems, applications, and services research space. 24 students were selected to receive travel awards. Awardees were notified of their selection and their travel grant allocation through email correspondence.
